1131.content:
You sit down in your seat next to your fellow Spartans. All of them are your closest friends and are the only family you've ever had. However, you realize that today some of them may disappear from your life forever. It had been 0400 hours when you and your team had been awoken from your sleep for some special op code-named: Knifepoint. All of you had been rushed into your gear and got aboard the Lance of Daybreak, a new UNSC stealth ship made from Covenant technology. You now sit in the infantry bay, twiddling with your helmet while you wait for instruction. Your Captain comes in to give your team the mission instructions.
         "Alright Spartans, this is a mission of the utmost importance. Your mission is to board the nearby Covenant Capital Ship, make your way to the control room, and capture the ship. Once you make it to the control room you will deactivate the airlocks, eliminating all remaining Covenant forces on board. If any of your suits are breached or if the Covenant become aware of your plan before you deactivate the airlock you must resort to plan B and destroy the ship. Plant just a few of your charges in the ship's engine room and steal one of the Phantoms docked in the ship's hangars. If it comes to this, you will signal for evac as soon as the ship is destroyed." Your commanding officer says, "If you can succeed on this mission, we shall be even closer to understanding Covenant technology. If we can begin replicating their scientific advances we will stand more of a chance in this war. Understood?"
         "Sir, yes sir!"
1131.title: The Razor's Edge

choices: The entry goes off without a hitch
The Covenant detect your ship and blow it apart, your team continues as planned.
11311.content:
The UNSC Lance of Daybreak then began to exit slipspace. You put you helmet back on and, like the rest of your team, equipped a jetpack to board the Covenant Cruiser.
         "Cloaking has been activated and we are now hovering over the target ship." The pilot says over the ships intercom, "Opening trooper bay in five." You took a slight intake in breath right before the hangar doors opened up, revealing the massive Covenant ship below. You and your team run out and begin jetpacking down towards the ship.

1231.content:
You and your team sit down for your mission briefing in front of your Staff Sargent. It has been only day since the Covenant has started their invasion of Reach and now your team have been recruited for some special op. Your blond hair is tied up in a pony-tail behind your head, that's the only reason you're allowed to keep it so long. You are holding your helmet in front of you and staring into the visor. You then spin it around, put it on, and tuck in your hair as your Sargent begins to speak,
         "Spartans, the situation is extremely dire. New Alexandria is being evacuated but the city is under heavy attack. You've been called here because you're the best pilots that the UNSC has to offer. You will be coordinating with troops on the ground to provide them support and to take out any resistance in the skies. Any questions?"
         "Sir! no sir!"
1231.title: Operation: Hellfire

12311.content:
The countdown had begun as you sat in your seat, preping the Sabre for launch. Your co-pilot, Bill, sat in the seat behind you. The two of you had been friends since you started your Spartan training at the age of six. On either side of you (the Sabre is facing upwards for liftoff) are the other members of your squad in their own Sabre fighters. Emily and Zack were over in the Sabre to your right and Clark and Page were on your left.
         "Omega Squadron, ready to launch." You say into your helmet's coms headset.
         "Roger that squad leader. Omega squad, you are clear for launch. Give em hell Spartans." The control tower operator responds. With a deep rumble your Sabre's engines start up and begin lifting you into the air. The extra propulsion rockets dislodge when you reach the correct height and you level out the ship.
         "Omega Squad form up." You say into your headset and begin the flight towards New Alexandria.

123111.content:
Over the radio you hear an air support request.
         "This is Noble 6, we're under heavy assault by Covenant ground forces. We need to push through to activate our anti-air weapons. We could use a hand." Bill picks up the transmission and responds,
         "Noble 6, this is Omega 2. We will provide air-support, what's your location?"
         "Just outside the city at coordinates 67590, requesting fire package Charlie. Danger close."
         "Roger that, E.T.A. 30 seconds." Bill says. You punch in the coordinates into the computer and select the fire package.
         "Noble 6, this is Omega 1. Fire package has arrived, get your heads down." You say as the charges are released. Earth-shattering explosions pound relentlessly down on the Covenant forces and Noble 6 responds,
         "Thanks for the assist Omega Squad. All units move up! Get those anti-air defenses activated!" The transmission then ends.
123111.title: A Noble Mission

info.brief_description: My new interactive story for fans of Sci-Fi and Halo.
info.description:
The Spartan program was the top most secretive program performed by the UNSC. The Spartan 1 program used normal humans in suits of mechanical armor, this program was a failure on account of the regular marine's fragile bodies couldn't take the fast movements of the suits. Then, researcher Dr. Halsey came up with the Spartan 2 program. In this program children were kidnapped and replaced with clones. The children were then trained as soldiers from the time they were six years old. They were also put under heavy augmentations to make them stronger and faster. 65-75% of Spartans were killed in training. The Spartan 3s were kept secret from Dr. Halsey and were much cheaper than Spartan 2s. Spartan 3s were typically used as reconnaissance squads for dangerous operations. The Spartan 4 program never "officially" existed. There was another program made however. One that was kept so secret that few even know that it exists. They were the Spartan 5s and you are a member of this group. You were trained from the time you were six to be a stone cold killer and so you now shall go out and put the Covenant in their graves.
Rule: No foul language
